div.head: CHAP. CI.
Dauid maketh a vow and profession of godlines.
div.ab: [A Psalme of Dauid.] I will sing of Mercie and Iudgement: vnto thee, O Lord, wil I sing.
I will behaue my selfe wisely in a perfect way, O when wilt thou come vnto me? I will walke within my house with a perfect heart.
I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the worke of them that turne aside, it shal not cleaue to me. Heb. thing of Belial.
A froward heart shall depart from me, I will not knowe a wicked person.
Whoso priuily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high looke, and a proud heart, will not I suffer.
Mine eyes shall be vpon the faithfull of the land, that they may dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serue me. Or, perfect in the way.
He that worketh deceit, shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarie in my sight. Heb. shall not be established.
I will earely destroy all the wicked of the land: that I may cut off all wicked doers from the citie of the Lord.
